intro: Epilobium cephalostigma, commonly known as the purple-flowered willow herb, is a herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Onagraceae family and is characterized by its upright stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, showy purple or pink flowers that bloom in summer. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows and along stream banks. Epilobium cephalostigma is also known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
